list_definition.definition: a person or machine that grinds

list_ex_of_english: In 1842, they added production of coffee, pepper, and salt grinders.
His legislation against organ grinders on the grounds that they were street nuisances was less successful.
Indents were made a year ago last month for machine tools, lathes, surface grinders and so on.
If there are more miners than grinders and preparers, the total number will rank for refund.
Apart from general broad definitions, such as turners, fitters, grinders and milling machine operatives, there were others, because new machinery had been introduced, bringing new methods.
Traditionally, two or more skilled tradesmen—millers, grinders, capstan operators or setters—may decide to break away from their company and to have a go on their own.
Manual devices include barrel-shaped presses, hand-operated grinders, and inverted cones upon which fruit is mashed and twisted.
Common foods served are sandwich grinders, pizza, and chef salads.
